brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the registry is to assess outcomes following treatment with lumbar total disc
      replacement (TDR) in patients outside the clinical trial setting.

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to capture outcomes associated with use of total disc
      replacement (TDR) in patients treated with either the CHARITE™ Artificial Disc or the
      PRODISC®-L Total Disc Replacement may be included in the registry.

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Treated with the lumbar TDR.

          -  Signed IRB approved consent document.

        Key Exclusion Criteria:

          -  None known.

study_pop.textblock:
Patients that undergo lumbar total disc replacement (TDR); this includes patients treated
        with either the CHARITE disc or the ProDisc-L disc

clinical_study.official_title: The Centers for Arthroplasty Research and Education in Spine (CARES) Lumbar Artificial Disc Registry Protocol

primary_outcome.description: The ODI assesses several domains of function affected by low back pain. A change of 15 points from baseline is considered a clinical meaningful difference for the individual. The change from pre operative baseline to each follow-up assessment will be calculated.
primary_outcome.measure: Change in Oswestry Disability Index (ODI) Score

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
clinical_study.why_stopped: Low enrollment and follow-up data on enrolled patients.
